co.cask.coopr.scheduler.task

Class ClusterJob

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.cask.coopr.scheduler.task.ClusterJob

  • public class ClusterJob
extends Object
    A job contains information related to what needs to be done to perform and coordinate a cluster operation. It keeps track of node level tasks that must be executed, and the stages in which tasks must be executed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ClusterJob.Status
      Job status.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClusterJob(JobId jobId, ClusterAction clusterAction)

      Create a cluster job with the given job id that represent the given action to perform on a cluster, for the given services on the given nodes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClusterJob

        public ClusterJob(JobId jobId,
          ClusterAction clusterAction)
        Create a cluster job with the given job id that represent the given action to perform on a cluster across all services and nodes on the cluster.
        Parameters:
        jobId - Id of the job.
        clusterAction - Action the job is carrying out.

      • ClusterJob

        public ClusterJob(JobId jobId,
          ClusterAction clusterAction,
          Set<String> plannedServices,
          Set<String> plannedNodes)
        Create a cluster job with the given job id that represent the given action to perform on a cluster, for the given services on the given nodes. Null values for services or nodes indicates that the job covers all cluster services or all cluster nodes.
        Parameters:
        jobId - Id of the job.
        clusterAction - Action the job is carrying out.
        plannedServices - Services affected by the job, with null indicating all services.
        plannedNodes - Nodes affected by the job, with null indicating all nodes.

    • Method Detail

      • getJobId

        public String getJobId()
        Get the id of the job.
        Returns:
        Id of the job.

      • getClusterId

        public String getClusterId()
        Get the id of the cluster this job is for.
        Returns:
        Id of the cluster this job is for.

      • getClusterAction

        public ClusterAction getClusterAction()
        Get the ClusterAction this job is trying to perform.
        Returns:
        Cluster action this job is trying to perform.

      • getStagedTasks

        public List<Set<String>> getStagedTasks()
        Get the ids of tasks that need to be run in order to perform the cluster operation broken down into stages. Each stage comprises one or more tasks which can all be run in parallel. However, tasks in one stage cannot be started until all the tasks in the previous stage have successfully completed.
        Returns:
        Ids of tasks that need to be run broken down into stages.

      • getPlannedServices

        public Set<String> getPlannedServices()
        Get cluster services to include in job planning. Services not in the set should not be included in job planning, with a null value indicating that all services should be included in planning.
        Returns:
        Cluster services to be included in job planning.

      • getPlannedNodes

        public Set<String> getPlannedNodes()
        Get cluster nodes to include in job planning. Services not in the set should not be included in job planning, with a null value indicating that all nodes should be included in planning.
        Returns:
        Cluster nodes to be included in job planning.

      • addStage

        public void addStage(Set<String> tasks)
        Add a stage of tasks to the job.
        Parameters:
        tasks - Set of tasks that can be run in parallel in a single stage.

      • getCurrentStage

        public Set<String> getCurrentStage()
        Get all the task ids for the current stage.
        Returns:
        Set of task ids for the current stage.

      • clearTasks

        public void clearTasks()
        Clear all tasks for the job. May be used when the job has failed and there is no point in continuing.

      • insertTasksAfterCurrentStage

        public void insertTasksAfterCurrentStage(List<String> tasks)
        Inserts a list of tasks after this stage. This is required for retries.
        Parameters:
        tasks - tasks to insert after the current stage.

      • hasNextStage

        public boolean hasNextStage()
        Return whether or not there is another stage of tasks to execute.
        Returns:
        true if there is another stage of tasks, false otherwise.

      • advanceStage

        public void advanceStage()
        Move on to the next stage. Should be called once all the tasks in the current stage have successfully completed.

      • getCurrentStageNumber

        public int getCurrentStageNumber()
        Get the current stage number.
        Returns:
        Current stage number.

      • setTaskStatus

        public void setTaskStatus(String taskId,
                 ClusterTask.Status status)
        Set the status of a specific task.
        Parameters:
        taskId - Id of the task whose status must be set.
        status - Status to set the task status to.

      • getTaskStatus

        public Map<String,ClusterTask.Status> getTaskStatus()
        Get a mapping of all task ids to their status.
        Returns:
        Mapping of all task ids to their status.
